channel.title: Video Streaming on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in Video Streaming on 0x000216

item.title: Gigabit WiFi For Video Streaming
item.description: WiFi has become the standard wireless connection due to its widespread availability, outpacing technologies like Bluetooth and WiMax. While cellular data is useful in the absence of WiFi, its limited bandwidth and potential for overage charges make it a secondary choice. In fact, data shows that most tablet users don’t even utilize their device’s cellular capabilities. WiFi’s strength is evident in its ability to not only replace cellular broadband but also wired connections.

item.title: 100 Gbps Wavelength Service Open for Business
item.description: While many businesses are enjoying the advantages of 100 Mbps Fast Ethernet, bandwidth capabilities are increasing exponentially. 100 Gbps wavelength service is now available on the West Coast, a thousandfold increase over standard 100 Mbps Ethernet. What necessitates such high bandwidth, and where can it be obtained? The factors driving the demand for 100 Gbps bandwidth are the same ones that make 100 Mbps nearly entry-level. Many smaller businesses struggle with their outdated T1 lines, which operate at a slow 1.

item.title: Unlimited Internet's Days are Numbered
item.description: Remember the golden age of air travel? You could stroll into an airport right before your flight, effortlessly purchase a ticket, and enjoy luxurious treatment onboard. Today, it’s a different story. We endure long lines and cramped seats, a far cry from the preferential treatment of the past. Sadly, this shift from luxury to cattle car is coming soon to the internet. You might be skeptical. After all, the internet has felt limitless for over a decade.
